item.name: debug

request.description:
This request truncates (with restart identity) and seeds the database.

> _**USE WITH CAUTION - All data is lost**_

item.description: The debug endpoint is primarily for debugging purposes.

request.description: Retrieves all passengers from the database and returns them as a list.

_**DEBUG ONLY:**_  
This endpoint creates a passenger without a flight binding (FlightId = null)
Updates a passenger in the database.

request.description: However, flightlogic does not perform any calculations except for fuel calculation. This is the first step in the 'flight creation' process. It creates a new flight in the 'planned' status, blocking only the flight slot for any other flight. The arrival time will be determined by the plane's 'FlightDuration' parameter.

response.body:
{
    "Success": true,
    "Response": {
        "ID": 1,
        "CreatedAt": "2024-02-02T12:27:26.709667+01:00",
        "UpdatedAt": "2024-02-02T12:27:26.709667+01:00",
        "DeletedAt": null,
        "Status": "PLANNED",
        "Description": null,
        "FuelAtDeparture": 100,
        "DepartureTime": "2024-01-24T14:30:00Z",
        "ArrivalTime": "2024-01-24T14:54:00Z",
        "PlaneId": 1,
        "Plane": null,
        "PilotId": null,
        "Pilot": null,
        "Passengers": null
    }
}

request.description:
This is the second step in the 'flight creation' process.  
It updates a flight from 'planned' to 'reserved' status, performing flight logic calculations such as pilot selection and weight checking.

It creates passengers for this flight with at least the weight attribute. Other attributes are optional and can be set later

request.description:
This is the third step in the 'flight creation' process. It updated a flight from 'reserved' to 'booked', validating and finalizing the flight.

It also gives you the possibility to edit all the passengers which you previously created.

exec: pm.test("Response time is less than 200ms", function () {
